title: Java Basics Quiz - (Loops & Arrays)
description: Take this quiz to see how well you understand loops and arrays. It includes loop control flow, indexing, iteration, and basic array operations.

multipleChoice.question:
What is the length of arr?
int[] arr = new int[10];

What is the default value of arr[2]?
int[] arr = new int[5];
Which loop header correctly visits every element of an int array named a?

Which code correctly uses the enhanced for-loop?
Array: int[] nums = {1, 2, 3};
Which line correctly declares and initialises an array with values 3, 6, 9?

trueFalse.question: An enhanced for-loop (for-each) can iterate over an array without using an index.
A while loop always executes its body at least once.
A do-while loop checks the condition before running the loop body.
Accessing an array index that is equal to its length will cause an exception.
In Java, the last valid index of an array with length 5 is 5.
The expression a.length gives the number of elements in the array a.
Using break inside a loop will skip only the current iteration and continue with the next one.
Using continue inside a loop will skip the rest of the current iteration.
All elements of a newly created int[] array are automatically initialised to 0.
The enhanced for-loop allows you to directly change the values stored in the original array by reassigning the loop variable.
